DataElement.preferredName: X-Ray Diagnostic Imaging Chest Width Assessment Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the value associated with the measurement of the maximum width of the chest/thorax.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: X-Ray Diagnostic Imaging Chest Width Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an assessment of the chest (the part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm, or abdomen) width (the extent of something from side to side) and X-ray imaging (diagnostic imaging through means of roentgen rays, recording the image on a sensitized surface).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Examination of any part of the body for diagnostic purposes by means of roentgen rays, recording the image on a sensitized surface (such as photographic film).:Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Examination of any part of the body for diagnostic purposes by means of roentgen rays, recording the image on a sensitized surface (such as photographic film).
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredDefinition: The part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.:Width; the extent of something from side to side.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.
The extent or measurement of something from side to side.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the value associated with the measurement of the maximum width of the chest/thorax.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement
